content:
Amsterdam Dance Event Foundation）组织，活动由ADE Pro，ADE Tech，ADE Tech，ADE University，ADE Beamlab，ADE Green，ADE Sound Lab等白天的活动以及ADE Festival夜间活动组成，在200多个俱乐部和举办地中，五天之内举办超过1,000项活动，2,500名艺人会参与。

 

ADE吸引了来自世界各地的超过40万人来到阿姆斯特丹。届时，它将成为世界上最繁忙的俱乐部城市之一。该活动从周三白天以高频率的全天节目开始，到第二周早晨结束。


历史

ADE始于1996年，最初为期3天，有30位DJ参加，有300名代表参加，ADE最初是在德巴里岛举行的，白天开幕，晚上在三个场所进行了演出：Paradiso，Melkweg和Club Escape。

 

活动流程

为期四天的ADE电音节围绕DeLaMar剧院（ADE Pro，ADE Green和ADE TECH），De Brakke Grond和Compagnietheater（ADE声音实验室和Beam实验室）以及Generator Hostel（ADE大学）举行。ADE还通过ADE Sound Lab向非专业音乐家敞开大门，邀请有抱负的艺术家和制作人与世界上最受欢迎的艺术家、DJ和制作人面对面，以获得专业意见。

 

ADE的最新活动形式是ADE by Day，该活动于2011年开始（当时称为ADE Playground）。但自2012年以来，该活动约有50场，包括顶级DJ的白天出场，艺术展览和表演，特别节目产品线，电影放映环节。

 

在2012年，ADE宣布正式将从四天的活动变为五天，原因是周日的活动大量撞车。 白天和晚上的演出阵容吸引了2500多名艺术家。全球范围内，总共有超过40万名俱乐部会员和音乐爱好者参加了比赛。
contentEn:
The Amsterdam Dance Event (ADE) is a five-day electronic music conference and festival held annually in mid-October. The event, organised by The Amsterdam Dance Event Foundation, offers a full programme of daytime conferences at ADE Pro, ADE Tech, ADE University, ADE Beamlab, ADE Green, ADE Sound Lab and ADE Beats alongside the ADE By Day festival programme and the nighttime ADE Festival, which features over 1,000 events and 2,500 artists over five days in 200 clubs and venues. The most notable event is the Amsterdam Music Festival (AMF) in the Johan Cruyff Arena on Saturday night.[1]

 

ADE attracts over 400,000 people from all over the world to the city, making Amsterdam[2][3] one of the busiest clubbing cities in the world. The event starts off on Wednesday with the daytime conferences and the extensive festival (day and night) programme and ends on Monday morning.

 

History

Started in 1996 as a three-day conference[3] and attended by 300 delegates with thirty DJs performing, the ADE was initially based in De Balie for the daytime conference and at night featured shows in three venues: Paradiso, Melkweg and Club Escape.

 

Programme

The four day ADE conference programme is based around the DeLaMar Theater (ADE Pro, ADE Green and ADE TECH), De Brakke Grond & Compagnietheater (ADE Sound Lab & Beam Lab) and Generator Hostel (ADE University). ADE also opens its doors to non-professional musicians with ADE Sound Lab, where aspiring artists and producers are invited to meet some of the world's most popular and in-demand artists, DJs and producers face-to-face in order to get expert opinions on their work.[3] The event's latest initiative is ADE by Day, which started in 2011 (then named: ADE Playground) as a new technology showcase, but since 2012 features around 50 events, surprise daytime appearances by top DJs, art exhibitions and performances, special product lines, film screenings, as well as discounts in shops and bars.[1]

 

In 2012 it was also announced that ADE would officially go from a four-day event to five days due to the rapidly growing number of 'afters' events on Sunday.

 

The day and nighttime line-up features over 2,500 artists as well as a selection of upcoming local and international talent, playing to a total of more than 400,000 clubbers and music enthusiasts in venues all over the city.[2]

 

References

  1. ^ Jump up to:a b "The international Dance industry assembles in Amsterdam next week". Dutch Daily News. 12 October 2012. Retrieved 31 January 2013.
  2. ^ Jump up to:a b "Amsterdam Dance Event highlights". iAmsterdam.com. Archived from the original on 21 January 2013. Retrieved 31 January 2013.
  3. ^ Jump up to:a b c "ADE: Amsterdam Dance Event". Local-Life.com. Retrieved 31 January 2013.

originalName: 阿姆斯特丹电音舞曲节;ADE
